Pre-Game Insights: Few expected New Zealand to make it out of the group featuring England and hosts Australia, let alone top it.
Pakistan qualified for the semi-finals despite winning just one of their first five games, evoking the spirit of their 1992 World Cup triumph.
Pakistan’s last three semi-finals in the T20 World Cup have resulted in losses.
Pakistan holds the edge over New Zealand in their T20 head-to-head record, having won 17 of the 28 matches.
New Zealand’s trusted pace attack includes Tim Southee, Trent Boult, and Lockie Ferguson.
Pakistan’s star openers, Mohammad Rizwan and Babar Azam, have struggled for fluency.
Glenn Phillips scored a century in New Zealand’s group game against Sri Lanka.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand has reached a fifth successive white-ball World Cup semi-final as group winners.
Pakistan scraped into the last-four by beating Bangladesh after a stunning upset of South Africa by the Dutch in the final round of group matches.
Shaheen Afridi has shown signs of returning to his best after injury and is ably supported by Haris Rauf and Mohamad Wasim.
